refnamediv.refpurpose: PAM module to set the default security context

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: In a nutshell, pam_libra sets up the default security context for the next execed shell.
When an application opens a session using pam_libra, the shell that gets executed will be run in the default security context.

Adding pam_libra into a pam file could cause other pam modules to change their behavior if the exec another application. The close and open option help mitigate this problem. close option will only cause the close portion of the pam_libra to execute, and open will only cause the open portion to run. You can add pam_libra to the config file twice. Add the pam_libra close as the executes the open pass through the modules, pam_libra open_session will happen last. When PAM executes the close pass through the modules pam_libra close_session will happen first.

listitem.para: Only execute the close_session portion of the module.
Only execute the open_session portion of the module.
attempt to inform the user when security context is set.

refsect1.title: MODULE TYPES PROVIDED
refsect1.para: Only the session module type is provided.

listitem.para: Unable to get or set a valid context.
